list_definition.definition: to move through water using arms and legs or fins, tails etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The children aren’t allowed to go sailing until they’ve learnt to swim
They watched the fish swimming about in the aquarium.

list_definition.definition: to cross (a river etc), compete in (a race), cover (a distance etc) by swimming

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He swam three lengths of the swimming-pool
She can’t swim a stroke (= at all).

list_definition.definition: to seem to be moving round and round, as a result of dizziness etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Everything began to swim before his eyes.
We went for a swim in the lake.

list_ex_of_english: No animal exhibited any change in swimming behavior after injection.
Effects of maternal stress during pregnancy on forced swimming test behavior of the offspring.
Since the embryos had hatched and were swimming, a consistent sample size (number of embryos/well) could not be obtained.
On land, a mouse or rat would immediately remove such an occluder, but they tolerate it while swimming.
Evidence for snail infection by free swimming miracidia was implied by the finding of empty worm egg casings.
As they swim, they push the layer forward, paving their own way.
Guidelines for cleaning swimming pool inflatables need to be developed.
You can literally dive in and swim into the view.
